verses.roman:
āsyatāṁ hy aravindākṣa
gṛhyatām arhaṇaṁ ca naḥ
bhujyatāṁ santi nīvārā
uṣyatāṁ yadi rocate

synonyms: āsyatām—please come sit here; hi—indeed; aravinda-akṣa—O great hero with eyes like the petals of a lotus; gṛhyatām—please accept; arhaṇam—humble reception; ca—and; naḥ—our; bhujyatām—please eat; santi—what there is in stock; nīvārāḥ—nīvārā rice; uṣyatām—stay here; yadi—if; rocate—you so desire.
translation: O King with eyes like the petals of a lotus, kindly come sit down and accept whatever reception we can offer. We have a supply of nīvārā rice that you may kindly take. And if you so desire, stay here without hesitation.
